creator: software+apache-httpd@kd6lvw.ampr.org
text:
They didn't seg fault (exit) in httpd 2.2.4.

At this time, all I have is log entries lke this one:

[Mon Sep 10 16:24:40 2007] [notice] child pid 31658 exit signal Segmentation 
fault (11)

In the past 19 hours, I've accumulated 4,780 of these entries in my syslog.  
Some requests are being served.

I know that such isn't being helpful in tracing where the problem is, but I 
haven't had the time to do that yet - and this is all that I have.  However, as 
2.2.4 doesn't have the problem, I suspect that a "diff" will narrow the search 
to the suspect code.  I would guess it's either in the cache or proxy services.

(Also, I can't select version 2.2.6 to report this under, so I used 2.2.4).

Going to close this invalid, reopen with backtrace etc when you have the
info, ---unless--- you find a report of the crash in the same function
in another bugzilla incident.  In that case, append your info to the
appropriate report.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
